definition:
Let $R$ be a ring, and let $A$ and $B$ be left (right) ideals of $R$.
Then the [*product*]{} of the ideals $A$ and $B$, which we denote $AB$,
is the left (right) ideal generated by all products $ab$ with $a\in A$
and $b\in B$. Note that since sums of products of the form $ab$ with
$a\in A$ and $b\in B$ are contained simultaneously in both $A$ and $B$,
we have $AB\subset A\cap B$.
